contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Lunar mare |name=Mare Anguis |image=[[Image:Manguis.jpg|200px]] |caption=Mare Anguis is the dark patch in the middle of this photo. The crater in the left center of the photo is [[Eimmart (crater)|Eimmart]], and is at the northwestern tip of Mare Anguis. The dark patch in the lower left corner is the northeastern edge of [[Mare Crisium]]. |eponym=Serpent Sea |latitude=22.6 |N_or_S=N |longitude=67.7 |E_or_W=E |diameter={{convert|150|km|mi|abbr=on}}<ref name=USGS>{{cite web |title=Moon Mare/Maria |publisher=USGS Astrogeology |work=Gazetteer of Planetary Nomenclature |url=http://planetarynames.wr.usgs.gov/SearchResults?target=MOON&featureType=Mare%2C%20maria |accessdate=2010-08-20}}</ref> }} '''Mare Anguis''' (the "'''serpent sea'''") is a [[lunar mare]] located on the near side of the [[Moon]], about 150 kilometers in diameter.<ref name=USGS/> Located within the [[Crisium basin]], Mare Anguis is a part of the [[Nectarian System]], meaning that it was formed during the [[Nectarian]] time period. Like most mare, the surface of Mare Anguis is dark, indicating that it has been filled with volcanic [[basalt]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Lunar maria}} {{moon-stub}} [[Category:Maria on the Moon|Anguis]]
